miic.core.inversion.inversion_with_missed_data¶

inversion_with_missed_data(dcs_dict=None, dcs_filename=None, threshold=0.6, window='win-0', save_dir=None)[source]¶

Simple inversion with hard thresholded velocity changes data.

This function does the inversion to estimate the “real” velocity changes adopting just those observed velocity changes that are associated to correlation values grater then threshold.

Parameters:
  • dcs_filename (string) – Filename of stored dictionary that contains the observed velocity change dv Panel, its corresponding correlation Panel and the stats DataFrame with the meta-information about the stations where the data have been collected.
  • corr_filename (string) – Filename of the observed correlation values stored in a DataFrame pickled object
  • threshold (float) – Minimum correlation value necessary to assume the associated velocity change meaningful
  • n_stations (int) – Number of stations
  • window (list of string) – If the velocity change were calculated on different time-lag windows, write here the window of interest (e.g. ‘win-0’)
  • save_dir (string) – If passed save the resulting dictionary in ‘adv_dict.pickle’ file.
Return type:

dictionary
Returns:

adv: Dictionary with the following keys: apparent_dv: It is the calculated “Real” velocity change

estimation sored in a DataFrame obj.

points_geo_info: DataFrame containing the geographical information

about all the stations involved in the inversion process.

residuals: The residuals calculated, at each time, for a general

inverse problem of the form R = (M’*M)^(-1) * M’ * O, it consist of the reconstruction error O - rec_O where rec_O = M * R.

Notes

ver. pandas >= 0.7 required
